availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Caldwell County, Kentucky, laborer. Caldwell County, Kentucky, native. Married Lucinda Kilgore Stevens in Caldwell County, Kentucky, on October 27, 1847. Father of Jonathan E. Stevens and P. W. Stevens. Laborer in Caldwell County in 1850. Killed by Wesley, a Black man enslaved by Jesse Williams, in Caldwell County on May 25, 1859.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, District 1, p. 292A.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Compiled Caldwell County Marriages, Film #000851644.
Kentucky Death Certificates, 1911-1965, Kentucky Office of Vital Statistics, KDLA, Frankfort, KY, File #4501.
